start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG ] .

This leads to the classical DLT problemÂ [29]:

minimizeğœ½âˆˆâ„121nâ¢â€–ğ€nâ¢ğœ½â€–2subjectâ¢toâ€–ğœ½â€–=1.subscriptminimizeğœ½superscriptâ„121ğ‘›superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptğ€ğ‘›ğœ½2subjecttodelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğœ½1\begin{split}\mathop{\rm minimize}\limits_{{\bm{\theta}}\in\mathbb{R}^{12}}% \leavevmode\nobreak\ &\frac{1}{n}\|{\bf A}_{n}{\bm{\theta}}\|^{2}\\ \mathop{\rm subject\leavevmode\nobreak\ to}\leavevmode\nobreak\ &\|{\bm{\theta% }}\|=1.\end{split}start_ROW start_CELL roman_minimize start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 12 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL start_CELL divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG âˆ¥ bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL roman_subject roman_to end_CELL start_CELL âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ âˆ¥ = 1 . end_CELL end_ROW (17)

The constraint inÂ (17) can be equivalently replaced with â€–ğœ½â€–=Î±normğœ½ğ›¼\|{\bm{\theta}}\|=\alphaâˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ âˆ¥ = italic_Î±, where Î±ğ›¼\alphaitalic_Î± is any positive real number333Here, â€œequivalentlyâ€ means that two problems yield the same optimal estimates of ğ‘osuperscriptğ‘ğ‘œ{\bf R}^{o}bold_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and ğ­osuperscriptğ­ğ‘œ{\bf t}^{o}bold_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.. The scale of ğœ½ğœ½\bm{\theta}bold_italic_Î¸ can be corrected by leveraging the constraint on a rotation matrix.

We denote the optimal solution to problemÂ (17) as ğœ½^nBsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½Bğ‘›\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm B}_{n}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_B end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. It can be calculated in a closed form as follows. Denote the SVD of ğ€nsubscriptğ€ğ‘›{\bf A}_{n}bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as ğ€n=ğ”ğƒğ•âŠ¤subscriptğ€ğ‘›superscriptğ”ğƒğ•top{\bf A}_{n}={\bf U}{\bf D}{\bf V}^{\top}bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = bold_UDV start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Then, ğœ½^nBsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½Bğ‘›\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm B}_{n}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_B end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the singular vector corresponding to the smallest singular value of ğ€nsubscriptğ€ğ‘›{\bf A}_{n}bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, i.e., the last column of ğ•ğ•\bf Vbold_VÂ [21]. This is equivalent to finding the eigenvector corresponding to the smallest eigenvalue of ğnâ‰œğ€nâŠ¤â¢ğ€n/nâ‰œsubscriptğğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğ€ğ‘›topsubscriptğ€ğ‘›ğ‘›{\bf Q}_{n}\triangleq{\bf A}_{n}^{\top}{\bf A}_{n}/nbold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰œ bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_n. Note that inÂ (16), the regressor matrix ğ€nsubscriptğ€ğ‘›{\bf A}_{n}bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT contains noisy measurements ğ±isubscriptğ±ğ‘–{\bf x}_{i}bold_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPTâ€™s and thus is correlated with the noise term ğœºğ±subscriptğœºğ±{\bm{\varepsilon}}_{\bf x}bold_italic_Îµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. As a result, according to estimation theory, ğœ½^nBsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½Bğ‘›\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm B}_{n}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_B end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is generally not asymptotically unbiased and consistentÂ [43]. This is verified in our simulation, see FigureÂ 5 in SectionÂ 7. In what follows, we are going to eliminate the asymptotic bias of ğœ½^nBsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½Bğ‘›\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm B}_{n}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_B end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and obtain a consistent estimate. Before that, we first analyze the noise-free case. The noise-free counterpart of problemÂ (17) is

minimizeğœ½âˆˆâ„121nâ¢â€–ğ€noâ¢ğœ½â€–2subjectâ¢toâ€–ğœ½â€–=1.subscriptminimizeğœ½superscriptâ„121ğ‘›superscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥superscriptsubscriptğ€ğ‘›ğ‘œğœ½2subjecttodelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğœ½1\begin{split}\mathop{\rm minimize}\limits_{{\bm{\theta}}\in\mathbb{R}^{12}}% \leavevmode\nobreak\ &\frac{1}{n}\|{\bf A}_{n}^{o}{\bm{\theta}}\|^{2}\\ \mathop{\rm subject\leavevmode\nobreak\ to}\leavevmode\nobreak\ &\|{\bm{\theta% }}\|=1.\end{split}start_ROW start_CELL roman_minimize start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 12 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL start_CELL divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG âˆ¥ bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL roman_subject roman_to end_CELL start_CELL âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ âˆ¥ = 1 . end_CELL end_ROW (18)

Note that ğ€nosuperscriptsubscriptğ€ğ‘›ğ‘œ{\bf A}_{n}^{o}bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is noise-free. From projection geometry, we have that ğ€noâ¢ğœ½o=0superscriptsubscriptğ€ğ‘›ğ‘œsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘œ0{\bf A}_{n}^{o}{\bm{\theta}}^{o}=0bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 0. Hence, ğœ½Â¯osuperscriptÂ¯ğœ½ğ‘œ\bar{\bm{\theta}}^{o}overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and âˆ’ğœ½Â¯osuperscriptÂ¯ğœ½ğ‘œ-\bar{\bm{\theta}}^{o}- overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, where ğœ½Â¯o=ğœ½o/â€–ğœ½oâ€–superscriptÂ¯ğœ½ğ‘œsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘œnormsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘œ\bar{\bm{\theta}}^{o}={\bm{\theta}}^{o}/\|{\bm{\theta}}^{o}\|overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT / âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥, are global minimizers of problemÂ (18). In addition, given nâ‰¥6ğ‘›6n\geq 6italic_n â‰¥ 6 points in general position, the matrix ğ€nosuperscriptsubscriptğ€ğ‘›ğ‘œ{\bf A}_{n}^{o}bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT has a rank of 11111111, in which case ğœ½Â¯osuperscriptÂ¯ğœ½ğ‘œ\bar{\bm{\theta}}^{o}overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the unique global minimizer ofÂ (18) up to sign. Then, the true pose [ğ‘oâ¢ğ­o]delimited-[]superscriptğ‘ğ‘œsuperscriptğ­ğ‘œ[{\bf R}^{o}\leavevmode\nobreak\ {\bf t}^{o}][ bold_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] can be recovered from ğœ½Â¯osuperscriptÂ¯ğœ½ğ‘œ\bar{\bm{\theta}}^{o}overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

However, in real applications, noise is inevitable, thus the noise-free matrix ğ€nosuperscriptsubscriptğ€ğ‘›ğ‘œ{\bf A}_{n}^{o}bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and the problemÂ (18) are not available in practice. Note that a unit eigenvector corresponding to the smallest eigenvalue of ğnoâ‰œğ€noâŠ¤â¢ğ€no/nâ‰œsuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘›ğ‘œsuperscriptsubscriptğ€ğ‘›limit-fromğ‘œtopsuperscriptsubscriptğ€ğ‘›ğ‘œğ‘›{\bf Q}_{n}^{o}\triangleq{\bf A}_{n}^{o\top}{\bf A}_{n}^{o}/nbold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰œ bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT / italic_n is a global minimizer ofÂ (18). This gives rise to the core idea of constructing a consistent estimator in this paper, i.e., analyzing and eliminating the asymptotic bias between ğnsubscriptğğ‘›{\bf Q}_{n}bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ğnosuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘›ğ‘œ{\bf Q}_{n}^{o}bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. With a bias-eliminated ğnBEsuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘›BE{\bf Q}_{n}^{\rm BE}bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT which satisfies â€–ğnBEâˆ’ğnoâ€–â†’0â†’normsuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘›BEsuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘›ğ‘œ0\|{\bf Q}_{n}^{\rm BE}-{\bf Q}_{n}^{o}\|\rightarrow 0âˆ¥ bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ â†’ 0 as nğ‘›nitalic_n increases, we can obtain a pose estimate (by executing the eigendecomposition of ğnBEsuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘›BE{\bf Q}_{n}^{\rm BE}bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT) that converges to the true pose. Now, we give such a ğnBEsuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘›BE{\bf Q}_{n}^{\rm BE}bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Define ğ—hâ‰œ[ğ—1hâ¢â‹¯â¢ğ—nh]â‰œsuperscriptğ—â„delimited-[]subscriptsuperscriptğ—â„1â‹¯subscriptsuperscriptğ—â„ğ‘›{\bf X}^{h}\triangleq[{\bf X}^{h}_{1}\leavevmode\nobreak\ \cdots\leavevmode% \nobreak\ {\bf X}^{h}_{n}]bold_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰œ [ bold_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹¯ bold_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ], ğ€~nâ‰œğ—hâŠ¤âŠ—[ğ3ğ3]âŠ¤â‰œsubscript~ğ€ğ‘›tensor-productsuperscriptğ—limit-fromâ„topsuperscriptsubscriptğ3subscriptğ3top\tilde{\bf A}_{n}\triangleq{\bf X}^{h\top}\otimes[{\bf e}_{3}\leavevmode% \nobreak\ \leavevmode\nobreak\ {\bf e}_{3}]^{\top}over~ start_ARG bold_A end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰œ bold_X start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_h âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ— [ bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, and ğ~nâ‰œğ€~nâŠ¤â¢ğ€~n/nâ‰œsubscript~ğğ‘›superscriptsubscript~ğ€ğ‘›topsubscript~ğ€ğ‘›ğ‘›\tilde{\bf Q}_{n}\triangleq\tilde{\bf A}_{n}^{\top}\tilde{\bf A}_{n}/nover~ start_ARG bold_Q end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰œ over~ start_ARG bold_A end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_A end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_n. Then, we have the following theorem:

Theorem 1.

Suppose Ïƒ^n2subscriptsuperscript^ğœ2ğ‘›\hat{\sigma}^{2}_{n}over^ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a nğ‘›\sqrt{n}square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG-consistent estimate of the measurement noise variance Ïƒ2superscriptğœ2\sigma^{2}italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Let ğnBEâ‰œğnâˆ’Ïƒ^n2â¢ğ~nâ‰œsuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘›BEsubscriptğğ‘›subscriptsuperscript^ğœ2ğ‘›subscript~ğğ‘›{\bf Q}_{n}^{\rm BE}\triangleq{\bf Q}_{n}-\hat{\sigma}^{2}_{n}\tilde{\bf Q}_{n}bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰œ bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_Q end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then,

ğnBE=ğno+Opâ¢(1/n).superscriptsubscriptğğ‘›BEsuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘›ğ‘œsubscriptğ‘‚ğ‘1ğ‘›{\bf Q}_{n}^{\rm BE}={\bf Q}_{n}^{o}+O_{p}(1/\sqrt{n}).bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 / square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG ) . (19)

Moreover, any unit eigenvector corresponding to the smallest eigenvalue of ğnBEsuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘›BE{\bf Q}_{n}^{\rm BE}bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, denoted as ğ›‰^nBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğ›‰BEğ‘›\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, is a nğ‘›\sqrt{n}square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG-consistent estimate of ğ›‰Â¯osuperscriptÂ¯ğ›‰ğ‘œ\bar{\bm{\theta}}^{o}overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT up to sign.

The proof of TheoremÂ 1 is presented in AppendixÂ A. CorollaryÂ 1 is a straightforward extension of TheoremÂ 1.

Corollary 1.

The estimate ğ›‰^nBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğ›‰BEğ‘›\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is an asymptotically unbiased estimate of ğ›‰Â¯osuperscriptÂ¯ğ›‰ğ‘œ\bar{\bm{\theta}}^{o}overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT up to sign.

Proof.

We will prove the case where ğœ½^nBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a nğ‘›\sqrt{n}square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG-consistent estimate of ğœ½Â¯osuperscriptÂ¯ğœ½ğ‘œ\bar{\bm{\theta}}^{o}overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. The proof of the case where ğœ½^nBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a nğ‘›\sqrt{n}square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG-consistent estimate of âˆ’ğœ½Â¯osuperscriptÂ¯ğœ½ğ‘œ-\bar{\bm{\theta}}^{o}- overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is similar. Due to the consistency of ğœ½^nBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, for any Ïµ>0italic-Ïµ0\epsilon>0italic_Ïµ > 0, we have limnâ†’âˆPâ¢(â€–ğœ½^nBEâˆ’ğœ½Â¯oâ€–1>Ïµ)=0subscriptâ†’ğ‘›ğ‘ƒsubscriptnormsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›superscriptÂ¯ğœ½ğ‘œ1italic-Ïµ0\lim_{n\rightarrow\infty}P(\|\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}-\bar{\bm{\theta}}^% {o}\|_{1}>\epsilon)=0roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n â†’ âˆ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P ( âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > italic_Ïµ ) = 0. In addition, note that both ğœ½^nBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ğœ½Â¯osuperscriptÂ¯ğœ½ğ‘œ\bar{\bm{\theta}}^{o}overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT are unit vectors. It holds that â€–ğœ½^nBEâˆ’ğœ½Â¯oâ€–1â‰¤2subscriptnormsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›superscriptÂ¯ğœ½ğ‘œ12\|\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}-\bar{\bm{\theta}}^{o}\|_{1}\leq 2âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ 2. Then,

ğ”¼â¢[â€–ğœ½^nBEâˆ’ğœ½Â¯oâ€–1]ğ”¼delimited-[]subscriptnormsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›superscriptÂ¯ğœ½ğ‘œ1\displaystyle\mathbb{E}[\|\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}-\bar{\bm{\theta}}^{o}% \|_{1}]blackboard_E [ âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]
=\displaystyle== âˆ«â€–ğœ½^nBEâˆ’ğœ½Â¯oâ€–1â‰¤Ïµâ€–ğœ½^nBEâˆ’ğœ½Â¯oâ€–1â¢Pâ¢(ğœ½^nBE)â¢ğ‘‘ğœ½^nBEsubscriptsubscriptnormsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›superscriptÂ¯ğœ½ğ‘œ1italic-Ïµsubscriptnormsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›superscriptÂ¯ğœ½ğ‘œ1ğ‘ƒsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›differential-dsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›\displaystyle\int_{\|\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}-\bar{\bm{\theta}}^{o}\|_{1% }\leq\epsilon}\|\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}-\bar{\bm{\theta}}^{o}\|_{1}P(% \hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n})d\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_Ïµ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P ( over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
+âˆ«â€–ğœ½^nBEâˆ’ğœ½Â¯oâ€–1>Ïµâ€–ğœ½^nBEâˆ’ğœ½Â¯oâ€–1â¢Pâ¢(ğœ½^nBE)â¢ğ‘‘ğœ½^nBEsubscriptsubscriptnormsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›superscriptÂ¯ğœ½ğ‘œ1italic-Ïµsubscriptnormsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›superscriptÂ¯ğœ½ğ‘œ1ğ‘ƒsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›differential-dsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›\displaystyle+\int_{\|\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}-\bar{\bm{\theta}}^{o}\|_{% 1}>\epsilon}\|\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}-\bar{\bm{\theta}}^{o}\|_{1}P(\hat% {\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n})d\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}+ âˆ« start_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > italic_Ïµ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_P ( over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
â‰¤\displaystyle\leqâ‰¤ Ïµ+2â¢Pâ¢(â€–ğœ½^nBEâˆ’ğœ½Â¯oâ€–1>Ïµ).italic-Ïµ2ğ‘ƒsubscriptnormsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›superscriptÂ¯ğœ½ğ‘œ1italic-Ïµ\displaystyle\epsilon+2P\left(\|\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}-\bar{\bm{\theta% }}^{o}\|_{1}>\epsilon\right).italic_Ïµ + 2 italic_P ( âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > italic_Ïµ ) .

Hence, ğ”¼â¢[â€–ğœ½^nBEâˆ’ğœ½Â¯oâ€–1]â†’0â†’ğ”¼delimited-[]subscriptnormsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›superscriptÂ¯ğœ½ğ‘œ10\mathbb{E}[\|\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}-\bar{\bm{\theta}}^{o}\|_{1}]\rightarrow 0blackboard_E [ âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] â†’ 0 as nğ‘›nitalic_n goes to infinity, which implies that ğœ½^nBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is asymptotically unbiased and completes the proof. âˆ

To leverage TheoremÂ 1, the remaining problem to be tackled is to obtain a nğ‘›\sqrt{n}square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG-consistent estimate of Ïƒ2superscriptğœ2\sigma^{2}italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. In the workÂ [44], a consistent estimator of noise variance is proposed for estimating output-error rational models. Inspired by this work, we give a consistent estimate of noise variance for modelÂ (8) in the following theorem:

Theorem 2.

Let Ïƒ^n2â‰œ1/Î»maxâ¢(ğnâˆ’1â¢ğ~n)â‰œsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ2ğ‘›1subscriptğœ†maxsuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘›1subscript~ğğ‘›\hat{\sigma}^{2}_{n}\triangleq 1/\lambda_{\rm max}({\bf Q}_{n}^{-1}\tilde{\bf Q% }_{n})over^ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰œ 1 / italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_Q end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Then, Ïƒ^n2âˆ’Ïƒ2=Opâ¢(1/n)subscriptsuperscript^ğœ2ğ‘›superscriptğœ2subscriptğ‘‚ğ‘1ğ‘›\hat{\sigma}^{2}_{n}-\sigma^{2}=O_{p}(1/\sqrt{n})over^ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 / square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG ), i.e., Ïƒ^n2subscriptsuperscript^ğœ2ğ‘›\hat{\sigma}^{2}_{n}over^ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a nğ‘›\sqrt{n}square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG-consistent estimate of Ïƒ2superscriptğœ2\sigma^{2}italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

Proof.

The proof is mainly based on the following lemma:

Lemma 1 ([45, Lemma 6]).

Let ğ‘ğ‘{\bf R}bold_R and ğ’ğ’{\bf S}bold_S be two real symmetric matrices and ğ=ğ‘+ğ’ğğ‘ğ’{\bf Q}={\bf R}+{\bf S}bold_Q = bold_R + bold_S. If ğğ{\bf Q}bold_Q is positive-definite and ğ‘ğ‘{\bf R}bold_R is positive-semidefinite with 00 eigenvalues, then Î»maxâ¢(ğâˆ’1â¢ğ’)=1subscriptğœ†maxsuperscriptğ1ğ’1\lambda_{\rm max}({\bf Q}^{-1}{\bf S})=1italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_S ) = 1.

FromÂ (19), we have

ğn=ğno+Ïƒ2â¢ğ~n+Opâ¢(1/n).subscriptğğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğğ‘›ğ‘œsuperscriptğœ2subscript~ğğ‘›subscriptğ‘‚ğ‘1ğ‘›{\bf Q}_{n}={\bf Q}_{n}^{o}+\sigma^{2}\tilde{\bf Q}_{n}+O_{p}(1/\sqrt{n}).bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_Q end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 / square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG ) .

This implies that limnâ†’âˆğn=ğno+Ïƒ2â¢ğ~nsubscriptâ†’ğ‘›subscriptğğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğğ‘›ğ‘œsuperscriptğœ2subscript~ğğ‘›\lim_{n\rightarrow\infty}{\bf Q}_{n}={\bf Q}_{n}^{o}+\sigma^{2}\tilde{\bf Q}_{n}roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n â†’ âˆ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_Q end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. On the one hand, in the noise-free case, ğ€noâ¢ğœ½o=0superscriptsubscriptğ€ğ‘›ğ‘œsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘œ0{\bf A}_{n}^{o}{\bm{\theta}}^{o}=0bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = 0, which implies that ğ€nosuperscriptsubscriptğ€ğ‘›ğ‘œ{\bf A}_{n}^{o}bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT does not have full column rank. Hence, ğnosuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘›ğ‘œ{\bf Q}_{n}^{o}bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is a positive-semidefinite matrix with 00 eigenvalues. On the other hand, since ğ€nsubscriptğ€ğ‘›{\bf A}_{n}bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is corrupted by random noises, given nâ‰¥6ğ‘›6n\geq 6italic_n â‰¥ 6 point correspondences, ğ€nsubscriptğ€ğ‘›{\bf A}_{n}bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT has full column rank with probability one, i.e., ğnsubscriptğğ‘›{\bf Q}_{n}bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is almost surely positive-definite. Then, according to LemmaÂ 1, we have limnâ†’âˆ1/Î»maxâ¢(ğnâˆ’1â¢ğ~n)=Ïƒ2subscriptâ†’ğ‘›1subscriptğœ†maxsuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘›1subscript~ğğ‘›superscriptğœ2\lim_{n\rightarrow\infty}1/\lambda_{\rm max}({\bf Q}_{n}^{-1}\tilde{\bf Q}_{n}% )=\sigma^{2}roman_lim start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n â†’ âˆ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 / italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_Q end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, i.e., Ïƒ^n2subscriptsuperscript^ğœ2ğ‘›\hat{\sigma}^{2}_{n}over^ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT converges to Ïƒ2superscriptğœ2\sigma^{2}italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Moreover, since ğnâˆ’Ïƒ2â¢ğ~nsubscriptğğ‘›superscriptğœ2subscript~ğğ‘›{\bf Q}_{n}-\sigma^{2}\tilde{\bf Q}_{n}bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_Q end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT converges to ğnosuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘›ğ‘œ{\bf Q}_{n}^{o}bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT with a rate of 1/n1ğ‘›1/\sqrt{n}1 / square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG, the convergence rate of Ïƒ^n2subscriptsuperscript^ğœ2ğ‘›\hat{\sigma}^{2}_{n}over^ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is also 1/n1ğ‘›1/\sqrt{n}1 / square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG, which completes the proof. âˆ

In the rest of this subsection, we give a procedure to recover pose [ğ‘^nBEğ­^nBE]subscriptsuperscript^ğ‘BEğ‘›subscriptsuperscript^ğ­BEğ‘›[\hat{\bf R}^{\rm BE}_{n}\leavevmode\nobreak\ \leavevmode\nobreak\ \hat{\bf t}% ^{\rm BE}_{n}][ over^ start_ARG bold_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] from ğœ½^nBEâˆˆâ„12subscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›superscriptâ„12\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}\in\mathbb{R}^{12}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 12 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. The procedure includes two parts: First, we correct the scale of ğœ½^nBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. By drawing lessons fromÂ [29], we utilize the fact that all three singular values of a rotation matrix ğ‘ğ‘\bf Rbold_R should be 1111 rather than detâ¢(ğ‘)=1detğ‘1{\rm det}({\bf R})=1roman_det ( bold_R ) = 1 to achieve a more robust result in practice; Second, we correct the sign of ğœ½^nBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and project its first 9999 elements to a rotation matrix. The specific procedure is given in AlgorithmÂ 2, which mainly depends on AlgorithmÂ 1. Note that ğœ½^nBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘›\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{n}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a nğ‘›\sqrt{n}square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG-consistent and asymptotically unbiased estimate of ğœ½Â¯osuperscriptÂ¯ğœ½ğ‘œ\bar{\bm{\theta}}^{o}overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT up to sign, and the operations in AlgorithmÂ 2 are all continuous. The retrieved pose [ğ‘^nBEğ­^nBE]subscriptsuperscript^ğ‘BEğ‘›subscriptsuperscript^ğ­BEğ‘›[\hat{\bf R}^{\rm BE}_{n}\leavevmode\nobreak\ \leavevmode\nobreak\ \hat{\bf t}% ^{\rm BE}_{n}][ over^ start_ARG bold_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] is a nğ‘›\sqrt{n}square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG-consistent and asymptotically unbiased estimate of [ğ‘oğ­o]superscriptğ‘ğ‘œsuperscriptğ­ğ‘œ[{\bf R}^{o}\leavevmode\nobreak\ \leavevmode\nobreak\ {\bf t}^{o}][ bold_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ].

5.2 Consistent estimation from line correspondences

With a little abuse of notation, in this subsection, we define ğœ½oâ‰œvecâ¢([ğ‘oâ¢ğ­oâˆ§â¢ğ‘o])âˆˆâ„18â‰œsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘œvecdelimited-[]superscriptğ‘ğ‘œsuperscriptğ­limit-fromğ‘œsuperscriptğ‘ğ‘œsuperscriptâ„18{\bm{\theta}}^{o}\triangleq{\rm vec}([{\bf R}^{o}\leavevmode\nobreak\ {\bf t}^% {o\wedge}{\bf R}^{o}])\in\mathbb{R}^{18}bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰œ roman_vec ( [ bold_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o âˆ§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ) âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 18 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. By combiningÂ (11) and ğ¥Â¯jo=[ğ‘oğ­oâˆ§â¢ğ‘o]â¢ğ‹jsuperscriptsubscriptÂ¯ğ¥ğ‘—ğ‘œsuperscriptğ‘ğ‘œsuperscriptğ­limit-fromğ‘œsuperscriptğ‘ğ‘œsubscriptğ‹ğ‘—\bar{\bf l}_{j}^{o}=\left[{\bf R}^{o}\leavevmode\nobreak\ \leavevmode\nobreak% \ {\bf t}^{o\wedge}{\bf R}^{o}\right]{\bf L}_{j}overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_l end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = [ bold_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o âˆ§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] bold_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we can also construct a matrix-form equation for mğ‘šmitalic_m line correspondences as follows:

0=ğ€mâ¢ğœ½oâˆ’ğœºğ¥,0subscriptğ€ğ‘šsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘œsubscriptğœºğ¥0={\bf A}_{m}{\bm{\theta}}^{o}-\bm{\varepsilon}_{{\bf l}},0 = bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_Îµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (20)

where

ğ€m=[[ğ©1hâ¢ğª1h]âŠ¤â¢ğ‹Â¯1â‹®[ğ©mhâ¢ğªmh]âŠ¤â¢ğ‹Â¯m],ğœºğ¥=[[Ïµğ©1hâ¢Ïµğª1h]âŠ¤â¢ğ¥Â¯1oâ‹®[Ïµğ©mhâ¢Ïµğªmh]âŠ¤â¢ğ¥Â¯mo],formulae-sequencesubscriptğ€ğ‘šmatrixsuperscriptdelimited-[]superscriptsubscriptğ©1â„superscriptsubscriptğª1â„topsubscriptÂ¯ğ‹1â‹®superscriptdelimited-[]superscriptsubscriptğ©ğ‘šâ„superscriptsubscriptğªğ‘šâ„topsubscriptÂ¯ğ‹ğ‘šsubscriptğœºğ¥matrixsuperscriptdelimited-[]superscriptsubscriptbold-italic-Ïµsubscriptğ©1â„superscriptsubscriptbold-italic-Ïµsubscriptğª1â„topsuperscriptsubscriptÂ¯ğ¥1ğ‘œâ‹®superscriptdelimited-[]superscriptsubscriptbold-italic-Ïµsubscriptğ©ğ‘šâ„superscriptsubscriptbold-italic-Ïµsubscriptğªğ‘šâ„topsuperscriptsubscriptÂ¯ğ¥ğ‘šğ‘œ{\bf end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG ] ,

and ğ‹Â¯j=ğ‹jâŠ¤âŠ—ğˆ3subscriptÂ¯ğ‹ğ‘—tensor-productsuperscriptsubscriptğ‹ğ‘—topsubscriptğˆ3\mkern 2.5mu\overline{\mkern-2.5mu\bf L\mkern-2.5mu}\mkern 2.5mu_{j}={\bf L}_{% j}^{\top}\otimes{\bf I}_{3}overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_L end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = bold_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ— bold_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. This leads to the DLT problem:

minimizeğœ½âˆˆâ„181mâ¢â€–ğ€mâ¢ğœ½â€–2subjectâ¢toâ€–ğœ½â€–=1.subscriptminimizeğœ½superscriptâ„181ğ‘šsuperscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptğ€ğ‘šğœ½2subjecttodelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğœ½1\begin{split}\mathop{\rm minimize}\limits_{{\bm{\theta}}\in\mathbb{R}^{18}}% \leavevmode\nobreak\ &\frac{1}{m}\|{\bf A}_{m}{\bm{\theta}}\|^{2}\\ \mathop{\rm subject\leavevmode\nobreak\ to}\leavevmode\nobreak\ &\|{\bm{\theta% }}\|=1.\end{split}start_ROW start_CELL roman_minimize start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 18 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL start_CELL divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_m end_ARG âˆ¥ bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL roman_subject roman_to end_CELL start_CELL âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ âˆ¥ = 1 . end_CELL end_ROW (21)

Since ğœ½âˆˆâ„18ğœ½superscriptâ„18{\bm{\theta}}\in\mathbb{R}^{18}bold_italic_Î¸ âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 18 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, and each line correspondence gives two independent equations, at least m=9ğ‘š9m=9italic_m = 9 line correspondences are required to ensureÂ (21) has a unique minimizer up to sign. We can calculate a minimizer, denoted as ğœ½^mBsuperscriptsubscript^ğœ½ğ‘šB\hat{\bm{\theta}}_{m}^{\rm B}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_B end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, via eigendecomposition. Note that inÂ (20), the regressor matrix ğ€msubscriptğ€ğ‘š{\bf A}_{m}bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT contains noisy measurements ğ©jsubscriptğ©ğ‘—{\bf p}_{j}bold_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPTâ€™s and ğªjsubscriptğªğ‘—{\bf q}_{j}bold_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPTâ€™s and thus is correlated with the noise term ğœºğ¥subscriptğœºğ¥{\bm{\varepsilon}}_{\bf l}bold_italic_Îµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Hence, ğœ½^mBsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½Bğ‘š\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm B}_{m}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_B end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in the line case also lacks asymptotic unbiasedness and consistency. Similar to the point case, define ğmâ‰œğ€mâŠ¤â¢ğ€m/mâ‰œsubscriptğğ‘šsuperscriptsubscriptğ€ğ‘štopsubscriptğ€ğ‘šğ‘š{\bf Q}_{m}\triangleq{\bf A}_{m}^{\top}{\bf A}_{m}/mbold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰œ bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_m and its noise-free counterpart ğmoâ‰œğ€moâŠ¤â¢ğ€mo/mâ‰œsuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘šğ‘œsuperscriptsubscriptğ€ğ‘šlimit-fromğ‘œtopsuperscriptsubscriptğ€ğ‘šğ‘œğ‘š{\bf Q}_{m}^{o}\triangleq{\bf A}_{m}^{o\top}{\bf A}_{m}^{o}/mbold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰œ bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT / italic_m. We are going to analyze and eliminate the asymptotic bias between ğmsubscriptğğ‘š{\bf Q}_{m}bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ğmosuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘šğ‘œ{\bf Q}_{m}^{o}bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Let ğ‹â‰œ[ğ‹1â¢â‹¯â¢ğ‹m]â‰œğ‹delimited-[]subscriptğ‹1â‹¯subscriptğ‹ğ‘š{\bf L}\triangleq[{\bf L}_{1}\leavevmode\nobreak\ \cdots\leavevmode\nobreak\ {% \bf L}_{m}]bold_L â‰œ [ bold_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ğ€~mâ¢1â‰œğ‹âŠ¤âŠ—[ğ1ğ1]âŠ¤â‰œsubscript~ğ€ğ‘š1tensor-productsuperscriptğ‹topsuperscriptsubscriptğ1subscriptğ1top\tilde{\bf A}_{m1}\triangleq{\bf L}^{\top}\otimes[{\bf e}_{1}\leavevmode% \nobreak\ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰œ over~ start_ARG bold_A end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT over~ start_ARG Then, we have the following theorem:

Theorem 3.

Suppose Ïƒ^m2subscriptsuperscript^ğœ2ğ‘š\hat{\sigma}^{2}_{m}over^ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a mğ‘š\sqrt{m}square-root start_ARG italic_m end_ARG-consistent estimate of the measurement noise variance Ïƒ2superscriptğœ2\sigma^{2}italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Let ğmBEâ‰œğmâˆ’Ïƒ^m2â¢(ğ~mâ¢1+ğ~mâ¢2)â‰œsuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘šBEsubscriptğğ‘šsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ2ğ‘šsubscript~ğğ‘š1subscript~ğğ‘š2{\bf Q}_{m}^{\rm BE}\triangleq{\bf Q}_{m}-\hat{\sigma}^{2}_{m}(\tilde{\bf Q}_{% m1}+\tilde{\bf Q}_{m2})bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰œ bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG bold_Q end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + over~ start_ARG bold_Q end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Then,

ğmBE=ğmo+Opâ¢(1/m).superscriptsubscriptğğ‘šBEsuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘šğ‘œsubscriptğ‘‚ğ‘1ğ‘š{\bf Q}_{m}^{\rm BE}={\bf Q}_{m}^{o}+O_{p}(1/\sqrt{m}).bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 / square-root start_ARG italic_m end_ARG ) . (22)

Moreover, any unit eigenvector corresponding to the smallest eigenvalue of ğmBEsuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘šBE{\bf Q}_{m}^{\rm BE}bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, denoted as ğ›‰^mBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğ›‰BEğ‘š\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{m}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, is a mğ‘š\sqrt{m}square-root start_ARG italic_m end_ARG-consistent estimate of ğ›‰Â¯osuperscriptÂ¯ğ›‰ğ‘œ\bar{\bm{\theta}}^{o}overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT up to sign.

The proof of TheoremÂ 3 is presented in AppendixÂ A.

Corollary 2.

The estimate ğ›‰^mBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğ›‰BEğ‘š\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{m}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is an asymptotically unbiased estimate of ğ›‰Â¯osuperscriptÂ¯ğ›‰ğ‘œ\bar{\bm{\theta}}^{o}overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT up to sign.

The following theorem gives a mğ‘š\sqrt{m}square-root start_ARG italic_m end_ARG-consistent estimate of noise variance from line correspondences:

Theorem 4.

Let Ïƒ^m2â‰œ1/Î»maxâ¢(ğmâˆ’1â¢(ğ~mâ¢1+ğ~mâ¢1))â‰œsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ2ğ‘š1subscriptğœ†maxsuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘š1subscript~ğğ‘š1subscript~ğğ‘š1\hat{\sigma}^{2}_{m}\triangleq 1/\lambda_{\rm max}({\bf Q}_{m}^{-1}(\tilde{\bf Q% }_{m1}+\tilde{\bf Q}_{m1}))over^ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰œ 1 / italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG bold_Q end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + over~ start_ARG bold_Q end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ). Then, Ïƒ^m2âˆ’Ïƒ2=Opâ¢(1/m)subscriptsuperscript^ğœ2ğ‘šsuperscriptğœ2subscriptğ‘‚ğ‘1ğ‘š\hat{\sigma}^{2}_{m}-\sigma^{2}=O_{p}(1/\sqrt{m})over^ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 / square-root start_ARG italic_m end_ARG ), i.e., Ïƒ^m2subscriptsuperscript^ğœ2ğ‘š\hat{\sigma}^{2}_{m}over^ start_ARG italic_Ïƒ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a mğ‘š\sqrt{m}square-root start_ARG italic_m end_ARG-consistent estimate of Ïƒ2superscriptğœ2\sigma^{2}italic_Ïƒ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

The proof of TheoremÂ 4 is similar to that of TheoremÂ 2 and is omitted here.

In the rest of this subsection, we give a procedure to recover pose [ğ‘^mBEğ­^mBE]subscriptsuperscript^ğ‘BEğ‘šsubscriptsuperscript^ğ­BEğ‘š[\hat{\bf R}^{\rm BE}_{m}\leavevmode\nobreak\ \leavevmode\nobreak\ \hat{\bf t}% ^{\rm BE}_{m}][ over^ start_ARG bold_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] from ğœ½^mBEâˆˆâ„18subscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘šsuperscriptâ„18\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{m}\in\mathbb{R}^{18}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 18 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. The procedure includes two parts: First, for the first 9999 elements of ğœ½^mBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘š\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{m}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we apply AlgorithmÂ 1 to obtain ğ‘^mBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğ‘BEğ‘š\hat{\bf R}^{\rm BE}_{m}over^ start_ARG bold_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and the scale correction sğ‘ sitalic_s and sign correction dğ‘‘ditalic_d of ğœ½^mBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘š\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{m}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT; Second, the matrix ğ­oâˆ§â¢ğ‘osuperscriptğ­limit-fromğ‘œsuperscriptğ‘ğ‘œ{\bf t}^{o\wedge}{\bf R}^{o}bold_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o âˆ§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is actually an essential matrix. An essential matrix has two identical positive singular values and one 00 singular valueÂ [46]. Hence, after correcting the scale and sign of ğœ½^mBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘š\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{m}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we let the last 9999 elements of ğœ½^mBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘š\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{m}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT meet the essential matrix constraint and obtain ğ„^mBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğ„BEğ‘š\hat{\bf E}^{\rm BE}_{m}over^ start_ARG bold_E end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, which is summarized in AlgorithmÂ 3. After that, the translation estimate is obtained by ğ­^mBE=(ğ„^mBEâ¢ğ‘^mBEâŠ¤)âˆ¨subscriptsuperscript^ğ­BEğ‘šsuperscriptsubscriptsuperscript^ğ„BEğ‘šsuperscriptsubscriptsuperscript^ğ‘BEğ‘štop\hat{\bf t}^{\rm BE}_{m}=(\hat{\bf E}^{\rm BE}_{m}{{}\hat{\bf R}^{\rm BE}_{m}}% ^{\top})^{\vee}over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( over^ start_ARG bold_E end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG bold_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¨ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. The whole procedure is given in AlgorithmÂ 4. Note that ğœ½^mBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğœ½BEğ‘š\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{m}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a mğ‘š\sqrt{m}square-root start_ARG italic_m end_ARG-consistent and asymptotically unbiased estimate of ğœ½Â¯osuperscriptÂ¯ğœ½ğ‘œ\bar{\bm{\theta}}^{o}overÂ¯ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT up to sign, and the operations in AlgorithmÂ 4 are all continuous. The retrieved pose [ğ‘^mBEğ­^mBE]subscriptsuperscript^ğ‘BEğ‘šsubscriptsuperscript^ğ­BEğ‘š[\hat{\bf R}^{\rm BE}_{m}\leavevmode\nobreak\ \leavevmode\nobreak\ \hat{\bf t}% ^{\rm BE}_{m}][ over^ start_ARG bold_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] is a mğ‘š\sqrt{m}square-root start_ARG italic_m end_ARG-consistent and asymptotically unbiased estimate of [ğ‘oğ­o]superscriptğ‘ğ‘œsuperscriptğ­ğ‘œ[{\bf R}^{o}\leavevmode\nobreak\ \leavevmode\nobreak\ {\bf t}^{o}][ bold_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ].

Remark 2.

As an alternative, one can independently recover a rotation matrix by decomposing ğ„^mBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğ„BEğ‘š\hat{\bf E}^{\rm BE}_{m}over^ start_ARG bold_E end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPTÂ [21, 47] and fuse it with that obtained from the first 9999 elements of ğ›‰^mBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğ›‰BEğ‘š\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{m}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. However, we do not adopt this scheme for two reasons: First, we find the fused result generally less accurate than only using [ğ›‰^mBE]1:9subscriptdelimited-[]subscriptsuperscript^ğ›‰BEğ‘š:19[\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{m}]_{1:9}[ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : 9 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. The reason may be that the accuracy of ğ„^mBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğ„BEğ‘š\hat{\bf E}^{\rm BE}_{m}over^ start_ARG bold_E end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is affected by both [ğ›‰^mBE]10:18subscriptdelimited-[]subscriptsuperscript^ğ›‰BEğ‘š:1018[\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{m}]_{10:18}[ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 10 : 18 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and sğ‘ sitalic_s (derived from [ğ›‰^mBE]1:9subscriptdelimited-[]subscriptsuperscript^ğ›‰BEğ‘š:19[\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{m}]_{1:9}[ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : 9 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT), while the accuracy of ğ‘^mBEsubscriptsuperscript^ğ‘BEğ‘š\hat{\bf R}^{\rm BE}_{m}over^ start_ARG bold_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in AlgorithmÂ 4 is only affected by [ğ›‰^mBE]1:9subscriptdelimited-[]subscriptsuperscript^ğ›‰BEğ‘š:19[\hat{\bm{\theta}}^{\rm BE}_{m}]_{1:9}[ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Î¸ end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : 9 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT; Second, the decomposition of an essential matrix will yield four possible combinations of rotations and translationsÂ [21, 47], and the correct one should be selected via geometric verification444The verifying principle is that the observed 3D lines should be in front of the camera., which is computationally demanding in the case of large mğ‘šmitalic_m.

5.3 Consistent estimation from combined point and line correspondences

In this subsection, we define ğœ½oâ‰œvecâ¢([ğ‘oâ¢ğ­oâˆ§â¢ğ‘oâ¢ğ­o])âˆˆâ„21â‰œsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘œvecdelimited-[]superscriptğ‘ğ‘œsuperscriptğ­limit-fromğ‘œsuperscriptğ‘ğ‘œsuperscriptğ­ğ‘œsuperscriptâ„21{\bm{\theta}}^{o}\triangleq{\rm vec}([{\bf R}^{o}\leavevmode\nobreak\ {\bf t}^% {o\wedge}{\bf R}^{o}\leavevmode\nobreak\ {\bf t}^{o}])\in\mathbb{R}^{21}bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰œ roman_vec ( [ bold_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o âˆ§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] ) âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 21 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. By combiningÂ (11) andÂ (14), we construct a matrix-form equation for nğ‘›nitalic_n point correspondences and mğ‘šmitalic_m line correspondences as follows:

0=ğ€nâ¢mâ¢ğœ½oâˆ’ğœº,0subscriptğ€ğ‘›ğ‘šsuperscriptğœ½ğ‘œğœº0={\bf A}_{nm}{\bm{\theta}}^{o}-\bm{\varepsilon},0 = bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - bold_italic_Îµ , (23)

where

ğ€nâ¢m=[[ğ€nâŠ¤]1:9âŠ¤ğŸ2â¢nÃ—9[ğ€nâŠ¤]10:12âŠ¤ğ€mğŸ2â¢mÃ—3],ğœº=[ğœºğ±ğœºğ¥].formulae-sequencesubscriptğ€ğ‘›ğ‘šmatrixsuperscriptsubscriptdelimited-[]superscriptsubscriptğ€ğ‘›top:19topsubscript02ğ‘›9superscriptsubscriptdelimited-[]superscriptsubscriptğ€ğ‘›top:1012topsubscriptğ€ğ‘šsubscript02ğ‘š3ğœºmatrixsubscriptğœºğ±subscriptğœºğ¥{\bf A}_{nm}=\begin{bmatrix}[{\bf A}_{n}^{\top}]_{1:9}^{\top}&{\bf 0}_{2n% \times 9}&[{\bf A}_{n}^{\top}]_{10:12}^{\top}\\ \lx@intercol\hfil{\bf A}_{m}\hfil\lx@intercol&{\bf 0}_{2m\times 3}\end{bmatrix% },\leavevmode\nobreak\ \bm{\varepsilon}=\begin{bmatrix}\bm{\varepsilon}_{{\bf x% }}\\ \bm{\varepsilon}_{{\bf l}}\end{bmatrix}.bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL [ bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : 9 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL start_CELL bold_0 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 italic_n Ã— 9 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL start_CELL [ bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 10 : 12 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL start_CELL bold_0 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 italic_m Ã— 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG ] , bold_italic_Îµ = [ start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL bold_italic_Îµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL bold_italic_Îµ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG ] .

This leads to the DLT problem:

minimizeğœ½âˆˆâ„211n+mâ¢â€–ğ€nâ¢mâ¢ğœ½â€–2subjectâ¢toâ€–ğœ½â€–=1.subscriptminimizeğœ½superscriptâ„211ğ‘›ğ‘šsuperscriptdelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥subscriptğ€ğ‘›ğ‘šğœ½2subjecttodelimited-âˆ¥âˆ¥ğœ½1\begin{split}\mathop{\rm minimize}\limits_{{\bm{\theta}}\in\mathbb{R}^{21}}% \leavevmode\nobreak\ &\frac{1}{n+m}\|{\bf A}_{nm}{\bm{\theta}}\|^{2}\\ \mathop{\rm subject\leavevmode\nobreak\ to}\leavevmode\nobreak\ &\|{\bm{\theta% }}\|=1.\end{split}start_ROW start_CELL roman_minimize start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 21 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL start_CELL divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n + italic_m end_ARG âˆ¥ bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Î¸ âˆ¥ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL roman_subject roman_to end_CELL start_CELL âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ âˆ¥ = 1 . end_CELL end_ROW (24)

Since ğœ½âˆˆâ„21ğœ½superscriptâ„21{\bm{\theta}}\in\mathbb{R}^{21}bold_italic_Î¸ âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 21 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, the constraint â€–ğœ½â€–=1normğœ½1\|{\bm{\theta}}\|=1âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î¸ âˆ¥ = 1 reduces one degree, and each point or line correspondence gives two independent equations, to ensure problemÂ (24) has a unique minimizer up to sign, it requires that n+mâ‰¥10ğ‘›ğ‘š10n+m\geq 10italic_n + italic_m â‰¥ 10. In addition, note that ğ­osuperscriptğ­ğ‘œ{\bf t}^{o}bold_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT only exists in the point measurementÂ (14), and ğ­oâˆ§â¢ğ‘osuperscriptğ­limit-fromğ‘œsuperscriptğ‘ğ‘œ{\bf t}^{o\wedge}{\bf R}^{o}bold_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o âˆ§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT only exists in the line measurementÂ (11), i.e., [ğœ½o]19:21subscriptdelimited-[]superscriptğœ½ğ‘œ:1921[{\bm{\theta}}^{o}]_{19:21}[ bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 19 : 21 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT can be only inferred from point correspondences, and [ğœ½o]10:18subscriptdelimited-[]superscriptğœ½ğ‘œ:1018[{\bm{\theta}}^{o}]_{10:18}[ bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 10 : 18 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT can be only inferred from line correspondences. It also requires that nâ‰¥2ğ‘›2n\geq 2italic_n â‰¥ 2 and mâ‰¥5ğ‘š5m\geq 5italic_m â‰¥ 5.

To devise a n+mğ‘›ğ‘š\sqrt{n+m}square-root start_ARG italic_n + italic_m end_ARG-consistent estimate fromÂ (24), define ğnâ¢mâ‰œğ€nâ¢mâŠ¤â¢ğ€nâ¢m/(n+m)â‰œsubscriptğğ‘›ğ‘šsuperscriptsubscriptğ€ğ‘›ğ‘štopsubscriptğ€ğ‘›ğ‘šğ‘›ğ‘š{\bf Q}_{nm}\triangleq{\bf A}_{nm}^{\top}{\bf A}_{nm}/(n+m)bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰œ bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / ( italic_n + italic_m ) and its noise-free counterpart ğnâ¢moâ‰œğ€nâ¢moâŠ¤â¢ğ€nâ¢mo/(n+m)â‰œsuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘›ğ‘šğ‘œsuperscriptsubscriptğ€ğ‘›ğ‘šlimit-fromğ‘œtopsuperscriptsubscriptğ€ğ‘›ğ‘šğ‘œğ‘›ğ‘š{\bf Q}_{nm}^{o}\triangleq{\bf A}_{nm}^{o\top}{\bf A}_{nm}^{o}/(n+m)bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰œ bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT / ( italic_n + italic_m ). Similar to the previous two subsections, we are going to analyze and eliminate the asymptotic bias between ğnâ¢msubscriptğğ‘›ğ‘š{\bf Q}_{nm}bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ğnâ¢mosuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘›ğ‘šğ‘œ{\bf Q}_{nm}^{o}bold_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_o end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.
