Appendix C Proof of TheoremÂ 7

Let fâ¢(ğ¬,ğ­)ğ‘“ğ¬ğ­f({\bf s},{\bf t})italic_f ( bold_s , bold_t ) denote the objective function ofÂ (13), where ğ‘=ğ‘^BEâ¢expâ¡(ğ¬âˆ§)ğ‘superscript^ğ‘BEsuperscriptğ¬{\bf R}=\hat{{\bf R}}^{\rm BE}\exp({\bf s}^{\wedge})bold_R = over^ start_ARG bold_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_exp ( bold_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ§ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), and denote the optimal ğ¬ğ¬\bf sbold_s and ğ­ğ­\bf tbold_t as ğ¬^MLsuperscript^ğ¬ML\hat{\bf s}^{\rm ML}over^ start_ARG bold_s end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ML end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and ğ­^MLsuperscript^ğ­ML\hat{\bf t}^{\rm ML}over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ML end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, respectively. Since ğ‘^BEsuperscript^ğ‘BE\hat{\bf R}^{\rm BE}over^ start_ARG bold_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and ğ­^BEsuperscript^ğ­BE\hat{\bf t}^{\rm BE}over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT are n+mğ‘›ğ‘š\sqrt{n+m}square-root start_ARG italic_n + italic_m end_ARG-consistent, it holds that

[ğ¬^MLğ­^ML]âˆ’[0ğ­^BE]=Opâ¢(1/n+m).matrixsuperscript^ğ¬MLsuperscript^ğ­MLmatrix0superscript^ğ­BEsubscriptğ‘‚ğ‘1ğ‘›ğ‘š\begin{bmatrix}\hat{\bf s}^{\rm ML}\\ \hat{\bf t}^{\rm ML}\end{bmatrix}-\begin{bmatrix}0\\ \hat{\bf t}^{\rm BE}\end{bmatrix}=O_{p}(1/\sqrt{n+m}).[ start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL over^ start_ARG bold_s end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ML end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ML end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG ] - [ start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL 0 end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG ] = italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 / square-root start_ARG italic_n + italic_m end_ARG ) .

Based on the optimality condition âˆ‡fâ¢(ğ¬^ML,ğ­^ML)=0âˆ‡ğ‘“superscript^ğ¬MLsuperscript^ğ­ML0\nabla f(\hat{\bf s}^{\rm ML},\hat{\bf t}^{\rm ML})=0âˆ‡ italic_f ( over^ start_ARG bold_s end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ML end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ML end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = 0 and the Taylor expansion, we have

0=âˆ‡fâ¢(0,ğ­^BE)+âˆ‡2fâ¢(0,ğ­^BE)â¢[ğ¬^MLâˆ’0ğ­^MLâˆ’ğ­^BE]+opâ¢(1n+m),0âˆ‡ğ‘“0superscript^ğ­BEsuperscriptâˆ‡2ğ‘“0superscript^ğ­BEmatrixsuperscript^ğ¬ML0superscript^ğ­MLsuperscript^ğ­BEsubscriptğ‘œğ‘1ğ‘›ğ‘š0=\nabla f(0,\hat{\bf t}^{\rm BE})+\nabla^{2}f(0,\hat{\bf t}^{\rm BE})\begin{% bmatrix}\hat{\bf s}^{\rm ML}-0\\ \hat{\bf t}^{\rm ML}-\hat{\bf t}^{\rm BE}\end{bmatrix}+o_{p}(\frac{1}{\sqrt{n+% m}}),0 = âˆ‡ italic_f ( 0 , over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + âˆ‡ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f ( 0 , over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) [ start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL over^ start_ARG bold_s end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ML end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 0 end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ML end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG ] + italic_o start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_n + italic_m end_ARG end_ARG ) ,

Then,

[ğ¬^MLâˆ’0ğ­^MLâˆ’ğ­^BE]=âˆ’âˆ‡2fâ¢(0,ğ­^BE)âˆ’1â¢âˆ‡fâ¢(0,ğ­^BE)+opâ¢(1n+m).matrixsuperscript^ğ¬ML0superscript^ğ­MLsuperscript^ğ­BEsuperscriptâˆ‡2ğ‘“superscript0superscript^ğ­BE1âˆ‡ğ‘“0superscript^ğ­BEsubscriptğ‘œğ‘1ğ‘›ğ‘š\begin{bmatrix}\hat{\bf s}^{\rm ML}-0\\ \hat{\bf t}^{\rm ML}-\hat{\bf t}^{\rm BE}\end{bmatrix}=-\nabla^{2}f(0,\hat{\bf t% }^{\rm BE})^{-1}\nabla f(0,\hat{\bf t}^{\rm BE})+o_{p}(\frac{1}{\sqrt{n+m}}).[ start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL over^ start_ARG bold_s end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ML end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 0 end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ML end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG ] = - âˆ‡ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f ( 0 , over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ‡ italic_f ( 0 , over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_o start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_n + italic_m end_ARG end_ARG ) . (28)

By combiningÂ (26) andÂ (28), we finally obtain

[ğ¬^MLâˆ’ğ¬^GNğ­^MLâˆ’ğ­^GN]matrixsuperscript^ğ¬MLsuperscript^ğ¬GNsuperscript^ğ­MLsuperscript^ğ­GN\displaystyle\begin{bmatrix}\hat{\bf s}^{\rm ML}-\hat{\bf s}^{\rm GN}\\ \hat{\bf t}^{\rm ML}-\hat{\bf t}^{\rm GN}\end{bmatrix}[ start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL over^ start_ARG bold_s end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ML end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG bold_s end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_GN end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ML end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_GN end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG ]
=(ğ‰âŠ¤â¢ğ‰)âˆ’1â¢ğ‰âŠ¤â¢ğ«âˆ’âˆ‡2fâ¢(0,ğ­^BE)âˆ’1â¢âˆ‡fâ¢(0,ğ­^BE)+opâ¢(1n+m)absentsuperscriptsuperscriptğ‰topğ‰1superscriptğ‰topğ«superscriptâˆ‡2ğ‘“superscript0superscript^ğ­BE1âˆ‡ğ‘“0superscript^ğ­BEsubscriptğ‘œğ‘1ğ‘›ğ‘š\displaystyle=\left({\bf J}^{\top}{\bf J}\right)^{-1}{\bf J}^{\top}{\bf r}-% \nabla^{2}f(0,\hat{\bf t}^{\rm BE})^{-1}\nabla f(0,\hat{\bf t}^{\rm BE})+o_{p}% (\frac{1}{\sqrt{n+m}})= ( bold_J start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_J ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_J start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_r - âˆ‡ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f ( 0 , over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ‡ italic_f ( 0 , over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_o start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_n + italic_m end_ARG end_ARG )
=((ğ‰âŠ¤â¢ğ‰n+m)âˆ’1âˆ’2â¢âˆ‡2fâ¢(0,ğ­^BE)âˆ’1)â¢ğ‰âŠ¤â¢ğ«n+m+opâ¢(1n+m)absentsuperscriptsuperscriptğ‰topğ‰ğ‘›ğ‘š12superscriptâˆ‡2ğ‘“superscript0superscript^ğ­BE1superscriptğ‰topğ«ğ‘›ğ‘šsubscriptğ‘œğ‘1ğ‘›ğ‘š\displaystyle=\left(\left(\frac{{\bf J}^{\top}{\bf J}}{n+m}\right)^{-1}-2% \nabla^{2}f(0,\hat{\bf t}^{\rm BE})^{-1}\right)\frac{{\bf J}^{\top}{\bf r}}{n+% m}+o_{p}(\frac{1}{\sqrt{n+m}})= ( ( divide start_ARG bold_J start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_J end_ARG start_ARG italic_n + italic_m end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 2 âˆ‡ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f ( 0 , over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG bold_J start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_r end_ARG start_ARG italic_n + italic_m end_ARG + italic_o start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_n + italic_m end_ARG end_ARG )
=Opâ¢(1n+m)â¢Opâ¢(1n+m)+opâ¢(1n+m)absentsubscriptğ‘‚ğ‘1ğ‘›ğ‘šsubscriptğ‘‚ğ‘1ğ‘›ğ‘šsubscriptğ‘œğ‘1ğ‘›ğ‘š\displaystyle=O_{p}(\frac{1}{\sqrt{n+m}})O_{p}(\frac{1}{\sqrt{n+m}})+o_{p}(% \frac{1}{\sqrt{n+m}})= italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_n + italic_m end_ARG end_ARG ) italic_O start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_n + italic_m end_ARG end_ARG ) + italic_o start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_n + italic_m end_ARG end_ARG )
=opâ¢(1n+m),absentsubscriptğ‘œğ‘1ğ‘›ğ‘š\displaystyle=o_{p}(\frac{1}{\sqrt{n+m}}),= italic_o start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_n + italic_m end_ARG end_ARG ) ,

where the second â€œ===â€ is based on the fact that âˆ‡fâ¢(0,ğ­^BE)=2â¢ğ‰âŠ¤â¢ğ«n+mâˆ‡ğ‘“0superscript^ğ­BE2superscriptğ‰topğ«ğ‘›ğ‘š\nabla f(0,\hat{\bf t}^{\rm BE})=\frac{2{\bf J}^{\top}{\bf r}}{n+m}âˆ‡ italic_f ( 0 , over^ start_ARG bold_t end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_BE end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = divide start_ARG 2 bold_J start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_r end_ARG start_ARG italic_n + italic_m end_ARG, and the third â€œ===â€ is based on LemmaÂ 2 in AppendixÂ A. Since the expexp{\rm exp}roman_exp is a continuous function, we also have ğ‘^MLâˆ’ğ‘^GN=opâ¢(1/n+m)superscript^ğ‘MLsuperscript^ğ‘GNsubscriptğ‘œğ‘1ğ‘›ğ‘š\hat{\bf R}^{\rm ML}-\hat{\bf R}^{\rm GN}=o_{p}(1/\sqrt{n+m})over^ start_ARG bold_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ML end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG bold_R end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_GN end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_o start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 / square-root start_ARG italic_n + italic_m end_ARG ), which completes the proof.

Appendix D Derivation of the CRB

The likelihood function is

â„’â¢(ğ‘,ğ­)=â„’ğ‘ğ­absent\displaystyle\mathcal{L}({\bf R},{\bf t})=caligraphic_L ( bold_R , bold_t ) = âˆi=1n14â¢Ï€2â¢|ğšº|â¢expâ¡(âˆ’12â¢ğ«pâ¢iâŠ¤â¢ğšºâˆ’1â¢ğ«pâ¢i)superscriptsubscriptproductğ‘–1ğ‘›14superscriptğœ‹2ğšº12superscriptsubscriptğ«ğ‘ğ‘–topsuperscriptğšº1subscriptğ«ğ‘ğ‘–\displaystyle\prod_{i=1}^{n}\frac{1}{\sqrt{4\pi^{2}|{\bm{\Sigma}}|}}\exp(-% \frac{1}{2}{\bf r}_{pi}^{\top}{\bm{\Sigma}}^{-1}{\bf r}_{pi})âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG 4 italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_Î£ | end_ARG end_ARG roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG bold_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_Î£ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
Ã—âˆj=1m14â¢Ï€2â¢|ğšºj|exp(âˆ’12ğ«lâ¢jâŠ¤ğšºjâˆ’1ğ«lâ¢j).\displaystyle\times\prod_{j=1}^{m}\frac{1}{\sqrt{4\pi^{2}|{\bm{\Sigma}}_{j}|}}% \exp(-\frac{1}{2}{\bf r}_{lj}^{\top}{\bm{\Sigma}}_{j}^{-1}{\bf r}_{lj}).Ã— âˆ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG 4 italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | end_ARG end_ARG roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG bold_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

Then, the log-likelihood function is

â„“â¢(ğ‘,ğ­)=â„“ğ‘ğ­absent\displaystyle\ell({\bf R},{\bf t})=roman_â„“ ( bold_R , bold_t ) = nâ¢lnâ¡14â¢Ï€2â¢|ğšº|âˆ’âˆ‘i=1n12â¢ğ«pâ¢iâŠ¤â¢ğšºâˆ’1â¢ğ«pâ¢iğ‘›14superscriptğœ‹2ğšºsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘›12superscriptsubscriptğ«ğ‘ğ‘–topsuperscriptğšº1subscriptğ«ğ‘ğ‘–\displaystyle n\ln\frac{1}{\sqrt{4\pi^{2}|{\bm{\Sigma}}|}}-\sum_{i=1}^{n}\frac% {1}{2}{\bf r}_{pi}^{\top}{\bm{\Sigma}}^{-1}{\bf r}_{pi}italic_n roman_ln divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG 4 italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_Î£ | end_ARG end_ARG - âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG bold_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_Î£ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
+âˆ‘j=1mlnâ¡14â¢Ï€2â¢|ğšºj|âˆ’12â¢ğ«lâ¢jâŠ¤â¢ğšºjâˆ’1â¢ğ«lâ¢j.superscriptsubscriptğ‘—1ğ‘š14superscriptğœ‹2subscriptğšºğ‘—12superscriptsubscriptğ«ğ‘™ğ‘—topsuperscriptsubscriptğšºğ‘—1subscriptğ«ğ‘™ğ‘—\displaystyle+\sum_{j=1}^{m}\ln\frac{1}{\sqrt{4\pi^{2}|{\bm{\Sigma}}_{j}|}}-% \frac{1}{2}{\bf r}_{lj}^{\top}{\bm{\Sigma}}_{j}^{-1}{\bf r}_{lj}.+ âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ln divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG 4 italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | end_ARG end_ARG - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG bold_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Let ğœ½ğ‘â‰œvecâ¢(ğ‘)â‰œsubscriptğœ½ğ‘vecğ‘{\bm{\theta}}_{\bf R}\triangleq{\rm vec}({\bf R})bold_italic_Î¸ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_R end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰œ roman_vec ( bold_R ) and ğœ½â‰œvecâ¢([ğ‘â¢ğ­])â‰œğœ½vecdelimited-[]ğ‘ğ­{\bm{\theta}}\triangleq{\rm vec}([{\bf R}\leavevmode\nobreak\ {\bf t}])bold_italic_Î¸ â‰œ roman_vec ( [ bold_R bold_t ] ). We have

Note that the rotation matrix should satisfy the SOâ¢(3)SO3{\rm SO}(3)roman_SO ( 3 ) constraint. This is equivalent to imposing the following 6666 quadratic constraints on ğœ½ğœ½\bm{\theta}bold_italic_Î¸Â [51]:

Finally, the constrained Fisher information is given asÂ [52, 53]

ğ…c=ğ”â¢(ğ”âŠ¤â¢ğ…ğ”)âˆ’1â¢ğ”âŠ¤,subscriptğ…ğ‘ğ”superscriptsuperscriptğ”topğ…ğ”1superscriptğ”top{\bf F}_{c}={\bf U}({\bf U}^{\top}{\bf F}{\bf U})^{-1}{\bf U}^{\top},bold_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = bold_U ( bold_U start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_FU ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_U start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŠ¤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,

and the theoretical lower bound for the covariance of any unbiased estimator is CRB=trâ¢(ğ…c)CRBtrsubscriptğ…ğ‘{\rm CRB}={\rm tr}({\bf F}_{c})roman_CRB = roman_tr ( bold_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

Appendix E MSE of the MLPnP estimator when Ïƒ=50ğœ50\sigma=50italic_Ïƒ = 50 pixels

Here, we set Ïƒ=50ğœ50\sigma=50italic_Ïƒ = 50 pixels. The result is shown in FigureÂ 20. In this case, the initial value of the MLPnP falls beyond the attraction neighborhood of the global minimum ofÂ (13). As a result, GN iterations drive the solution further away from the global minimizer, yielding a large MSE. Since the proposed AOPnP estimator is nğ‘›\sqrt{n}square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG-consistent in its first step, a single GN iteration can make it asymptotically reach the CRB.
